snippet: Buying damaged properties and returning them to their natural state to protect residents from future floods is one of the best ideas to come along.
abstract: Editorial supports New York Gov Andrew Cuomo's $400 million plan to buy and raze homes damaged by Hurricane Sandy; observes plan would only allow fraction of owners of 10,000 or so homes that lie in areas susceptible to flooding to participate but says idea is still one of best to come along.
lead_paragraph: Buying damaged properties and returning them to their natural state to protect residents from future floods is one of the best ideas to come along.
